main event: An object 15-20' in diameter was sighted leaving a trail, possibly due to extreme speed and brightness in Albuquerque, New Mexico on May 18, 1958.
interesting points: The object was observed for 3 seconds,The sighting conditions were described as adverse,The object was described as round and emitting a luminous flame color of blue-purple,The sighting is highly suggestive of a meteor,As per the report, the observer had 15 years of experience in the Civil Aeronautics Authority.
sighted object: a round object with a luminous flame color, blue-purple
witness description: civil aeronautics authority observer with 15 years of experience
